content: Download Graphical Analysis from the Vernier website or the appropriate web store. The app is available for Windows and macOS computers, Chrome computing devices, iOS and iPadOS devices, and Android devices.

subsections.content: Graphical Analysis can be downloaded from different sources depending on your platform.

procedures.instruction: For Windows and macOS computers, download from the Vernier website at www.vernier.com/graphical-analysis
For Chrome computing devices, download from the Chrome Web Store
For iOS and iPadOS devices, download from the App Store
For Android devices, download from Google Play

subsections.content: Graphical Analysis is a free app for computers and mobile devices. Graphical Analysis Pro is a subscription-based set of advanced features.

procedures.instruction: Graphical Analysis is free for Windows and macOS computers with unlimited installations
procedures.tip: No license key required for basic Graphical Analysis

procedures.instruction: Graphical Analysis is free for Chrome, iOS, iPadOS, and Android through respective web stores
procedures.tip: Terms and licensing determined by the web stores

procedures.instruction: Graphical Analysis Pro features require a subscription and are licensed for devices owned or used by students and faculty of the purchasing school or college department
procedures.tip: Transferring the license key outside the school or college department is prohibited

subsections.content: Graphical Analysis and Graphical Analysis Pro comply with COPPA, SOPIPA, and FERPA regulations.

procedures.instruction: Graphical Analysis does not collect, request, share, or store any personal information from students or instructors
procedures.tip: Your data stays on your device

procedures.instruction: Graphical Analysis does not display advertisements in the app
procedures.tip: Ad-free experience for all users

section_title: Launching Graphical Analysis for the First Time
content: When Graphical Analysis is launched without any sensors connected, the New Experiment box displays with options to choose which type of experiment you want to do.

subsections.content: Choose Sensor Data Collection to collect data from Vernier sensors including Go Direct sensors, Go!Temp and Go!Motion USB sensors, and wired LabQuest sensors.

procedures.instruction: Click or tap Sensor Data Collection to start collecting data from Vernier sensors
procedures.tip: If a sensor is connected via USB when launching, this is automatically selected

subsections.content: Choose Data Sharing to receive wirelessly streamed sensor data from a Data Sharing source such as LabQuest 2, LabQuest 3, Logger Pro, or Graphical Analysis Pro.

procedures.instruction: Click or tap Data Sharing to connect to a data sharing source
procedures.tip: Requires Graphical Analysis Pro features for GA Pro data sharing sources

subsections.content: Choose Manual Entry to manually enter data into a data table for analysis of non-sensor data.

procedures.instruction: Click or tap Manual Entry to start an experiment where you manually enter data
procedures.tip: Use this for data from textbooks, internet, or non-sensor experiments

subsections.content: Access saved files and sample data from the New Experiment box.

procedures.instruction: Click or tap Open Saved Files to access previously saved Graphical Analysis files or CSV files
Click or tap Sample Data to access sample experiment files
procedures.tip: Graphical Analysis Pro provides access to over 40 additional sample experiments

subsections.content: Customize the display with light or dark mode and adjust the scale factor for font sizes.

procedures.instruction: Click or tap Other Options on the top toolbar
Choose Presentation to access display settings
Toggle between light and dark mode as desired
procedures.tip: If your device has a dark mode setting, Graphical Analysis uses that by default

procedures.instruction: Use the slider to change the font scale factor
procedures.tip: Reduce the Scale Factor when viewing multiple graphs to see more detail

section_title: Quick Start to Sensor Data Collection and Analysis
content: Follow these steps to quickly get started with basic sensor data collection and analysis.

subsections.content: A step-by-step guide to collecting and analyzing sensor data.

procedures.instruction: Launch Graphical Analysis app
Select Sensor Data Collection and connect a sensor
procedures.tip: The default collection rate for the sensor is automatically set

procedures.instruction: Click or tap the Collect button to start data collection
procedures.tip: During collection, the Collect button changes to a Stop button

procedures.instruction: Click or tap Stop to manually end data collection
procedures.tip: Collection stops automatically when the duration is reached

procedures.instruction: Click or tap Zoom to scale the graph to fit the data
procedures.tip: You can also double-click or double-tap the graph to autoscale

procedures.instruction: Click or tap the graph to examine a point of interest
procedures.tip: Drag the Examine line or click different points to explore your data

procedures.instruction: Click-and-drag or touch-and-drag across the graph to select a region for analysis
procedures.tip: To analyze all data, you don't need to select a region

procedures.instruction: Click or tap Graph Tools and choose View Statistics
procedures.tip: Statistics information displays on the graph for the selected region

procedures.instruction: To fit a curve, click Graph Tools, choose Apply Curve Fit, then select the desired fit equation
Click Apply to display the curve fit equation and coefficients on the graph

section_title: Looking at the Graphical Analysis Tools
content: Overview of the main tools and interface elements in Graphical Analysis.

subsections.content: The main toolbar provides access to essential functions for working with experiments.

procedures.instruction: Use the File menu to start a new experiment, open saved experiments, save work, or export graphs and data
Use Collect and Stop buttons to control data collection
Click the Pro Authorization button to unlock Graphical Analysis Pro features
Use View Options to adjust display including graphs, data table, or sensor meters
procedures.tip: With GA Pro, you can also add videos

procedures.instruction: Access Other Options to modify font sizes, access user manual, and see what's new

subsections.content: Tools for customizing and analyzing graph data.

procedures.instruction: Use x- and y-axis labels to change what data are plotted on your graph
Customize graph appearance by changing point symbols and trace colors
Access data analysis tools from Graph Tools menu including curve fits, statistics, and integral
Use Zoom to scale your graph to all data or a selection

subsections.content: Tools for configuring sensors and data collection parameters.

procedures.instruction: Use Mode to set data-collection mode and modify parameters like rate and duration
Access sensor meters to change units and calibrate sensors
Use Sensor Setup to view connected sensors, connect wireless sensors, and modify sensor channels

section_title: Summarizing the Graphical Analysis Pro Features
content: Overview of the advanced features available with a Graphical Analysis Pro subscription.

subsections.content: Graphical Analysis Pro includes over 40 sample experiments with data and videos for middle school, biology, chemistry, and physics.

procedures.instruction: Access sample experiments from the File menu or New Experiment screen
procedures.tip: Use these files as-is or as inspiration to create your own

subsections.content: Stream sensor data to other devices running Graphical Analysis Pro via the internet.

procedures.instruction: Use Graphical Analysis Pro as a data sharing source to stream data to other devices
procedures.tip: Requires a live internet connection

subsections.content: Replay time-based data collections with control over replay speed.

procedures.instruction: Use replay controls to review time-based data collections
procedures.tip: Pair with synced videos for enhanced analysis

subsections.content: Add videos to experiment files and sync them with time-based data collections.

procedures.instruction: Add videos to illustrate how experiments were conducted
Sync videos with data collection for enhanced analysis

subsections.content: Create custom curve fit functions beyond the standard options.

procedures.instruction: Create custom expressions for curve fits using mathematical functions
procedures.tip: Examples include modified linear, modified quadratic, base-10 exponent, and Gaussian

subsections.content: Use mathematical functions to define custom expressions for calculated columns.

procedures.instruction: Create calculated columns using custom mathematical expressions
procedures.tip: Available functions include square root, trigonometric, logarithmic, and more

subsections.content: Perform Fast Fourier Transform analysis of time-based data.

procedures.instruction: Apply FFT to analyze frequencies in your data
procedures.tip: Commonly used for microphone data and identifying electronic noise
